FAIL_TO_PASS: when global option after parameter with same name as subcommand then global option parsed
when negatable boolean flag not specified then value is true
when digit option defined and option-argument is -1x then negative not consumed
when program has combo known boolean short flags then arg removed
when unrecognised argument and known option then asterisk action called
when "short|long" flags defined and short specified then value is true
when option defined with --word-word then option property is wordWord
when digit option defined and option-argument is -.1 then negative not consumed
when option-argument for short optional is -1e-3.0 then consumed=false
when option defined with --Word then option property is Word
when only short flag defined and specified then value is true
when option-argument for short optional is -x-1 then consumed=false
when boolean option with default used twice then value is true
when env defined with value and no cli then option true
when env and cli defined then only parse value for cli
when has conflicting option then throw CommanderError
when combo flag and negated then value is false
when option before command-argument then option parsed
when option-argument for short optional is --1 then consumed=false
when digit option defined and option-argument is -1e-3.0 then negative not consumed
